content: Tell me about a small, unexpected moment of joy you've had lately.
What's something you're grateful for today that wasn't even on your radar a year ago?
Is there a habit or routine that's been a genuine game-changer for you recently?
What's one thing you're hoping to learn or try in the next year, just for the fun of it?
Describe your perfect 'no-obligations' day, from the moment you wake up to when you go to sleep.
You're hosting a dinner party with any three people from history. Who's on the guest list and why?
Right now, what's one thing on the horizon that you're genuinely excited about?
What's a piece of art—like a book, movie, or song—that has truly stuck with you?
Tell me about a small act of kindness someone showed you that you still remember.
What's a personal quirk or an unusual way you do a totally normal thing?
What's a piece of advice that actually changed how you live your life?
When you think of your best friendships, what's the one ingredient they all have in common?
When you're feeling down, what's something that reliably lifts your spirits?
What's a topic you've fallen down a rabbit hole on recently?
When you need to truly recharge, what's your go-to method?
Is there a place in the world that just feels like 'you'?
If you could instantly master one skill, what would it be and what's the first thing you'd do with it?
You're gifted a completely free afternoon. How are you spending it?
What's a simple pleasure that never fails to put you in a good mood?
What's something you're delightfully bad at, but love to do anyway?
When was the last time you did something truly spontaneous?
What's an activity that makes the hours feel like minutes for you?
Do you have a personal tradition you love, or one you'd like to start?
When you're feeling totally drained, what's one thing that energizes you?
If you could step back into one memory for just a moment, which one would you choose?
What's one thing you've been meaning to do but just haven't gotten around to yet?
What's a stereotype about your generation that you think is totally wrong—or surprisingly right?
What's a compliment you've received that you still think about?
